etymology.description: Depicts a container and its lid -> container concept -> original form of 蓋(蓋) (gài, "cover")
etymology.interpretation: The character 盍(盍) (hé, "why not") visually represents a container with a lid, signifying the sense of covering or enclosing, which later phonetically evolved for its current use in Classical Chinese as a rhetorical 'why not'.
